Articles.Content:
Im bloody annoyed on the system on loading landed objects, "Oh got a big rover, dont worry Mate we will make its ******* wheels clip into the terrain and cause a shockwave to pull the rover apart." "Oh you thought your rover was fine, NO WE ARE ******* HERE TO PULL YOUR ROVER TO ******* SMITHEREENS!" And this is putting a LOT of stress on me, if this is a bug then how do I fix it, I'm  just bloody fed up. However if it cannot be fixed, here are 2 SIMPLE improvements to stop this.

1) Cancel out all velocities on all ships, this prevents them from moving further into terrain and causing even more mayhem than the problem would usually.

2) Make all landed vehicles touching ground hover a meter above ground for the duration of the load, this way they dont touch and melt into the ground.

For the time being, use landing legs to lift the rover off the surface (though I've never had this problem myself). As for option 2, that would be very bad for bases and rovers on low gravity bodies like, say, Minmus.
